intro: Lisianthius acuminatus, commonly known as the sharp-leaved lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, with yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale purple to white ray florets. Lisianthius acuminatus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and open woods.
